geospatial-analytics.title: Geospatial Analytics
description: Due to my deep interest in geography, Geospatial Analytics is what I spend most of my coding time on. Be it malls, schools, buses, roads, MRT or others, a lot of my projects involve Singapore's urban geography in one way or another.
A typical project would first include the data extraction process, which means either performing
or calling data from API. Next, using my
, I process this data and perform
I'd say Geospatial Analytics best describes my work during my
. Be it predicting and optimising ambulance response times, to finding trends in fire alarm data, this skill was intensely practiced during my time there.
But I think I'm most proud of my
, which really was the culmination of all the geospatial skills I've picked up till then.

web-programming.title: Web Programming
description: I've done a lot of personal websites over the years. This is version 6 of my personal website, based entirely in
. But before this, I have practiced quite a bit of UI/UX skills, incorporating design elements inspired by different sites out there.
Apart from these personal websites, I have also created actual projects that use frameworks in one way or another. This would include my
project, which was designed using the MEVN tech stack for Orbital. Other projects use frameworks such as
Professionally though, I've designed an organization-wide data governance portal during my time in the
, which aimed at enforcing sound data management principles. During my time in
, I also assisted in the development of the department website.

data-mining.title: Data Mining
description: useful information, patterns and trends from raw data. It consists firstly of understanding and preparing the business data, followed by building models and evaluating the results.
Indeed, this perfectly describes my role in

, where I was often tasked to extract data to predict and describe outcomes using machine learning processes. This mainly came in the form of the optimization model that I operated, but I also applied this to my juniors' work, supervising them in the development of data science models for the Logistics Department.

music-transcription.title: Music Transcription
description: Inspired by piano tutorial channels like LittleTranscriber, I started creating my own piano covers of popular music in early 2019. Among them, my covers of

operational-analysis.title: Operational Analysis
description: Operational Analysis involves examining the current and historical perfomance of operations. Similarly to
, I was heavily involved in Operational Analysis during my time in
. This included the visualizations I've done using

. Mainly, senior officers from other departments would approach my supervisor for assistance (since we are the analytics branch). Then, my supervisor would explain to me the situation the department is in, and what needs to be accomplished through the data. Then, I would proceed with the analysis, finding as many useful trends as I can, before presenting the findings.

databases.title: Databases
description: My experience in databases first started when I took the Python course by the University of Michigan. It taught SQL quite briefly, but I managed to get the gist of it.
Further along, during my time in
, I was taught various database concepts, from virtualization, to cloud storage, to ETL scripts. As such, I was involved in producing SSMS scripts as part of data pipeline development.
Besides work, my various web progamming projects also use databases in one form or another. One in

I also have the various databases on Google Sheets, used for various purposes. For example, 'Geo' is used for storing geospatial data while 'Language' is used for storing vocabulary and grammar points for the languages I'm currently learning.

data-science.title: Data Science
description: My data science journey started when I entered my

, where I was tasked with simple data-cleaning tasks. However, the complexity of my work rapidly increased when I was exposed to the DRO project, which was an analytics model used to optimise the placement of ambulances in Singapore. I operates and closely maintained the model, resolving issues on my own as much as possible. From there, I had to answer analytics queries from various departments using the findings from the model, either by using
Besides work, however, my interests in Geography and Music took control. For geography, I made many packages and projects to assist in the data science process, which eventually led me to creating my
whose solutions were visualized on Jupyter Notebook.
On the other hand, thanks to my knowledge on Deep Learning from my IBM course, I also developed RNN models to predict music chords, although they don't work very well.

data-visualization.title: Data Visualization
description: There isn't any particular personal project that I fully applied data visualization on.  However, I do have quite a bit of professional experience in this, with visualization software such as
, I've done many ad-hoc dashboards (that I don't think I'm allowed to go into detail).
I also participated in the Data Analytics Competition organized by the NUS Statistics and Data Science Society, where teams had to visualize Grab taxi data.

data-extraction.title: Data Extraction
description: Data Extraction is an essential part of the data science process, as it is responsible for retrieving the data.

This can be achieved through Web Scraping, which is just my favourite thing to do. Professionally, I haven't had to do much, just extract information about Community Centres and Neighbourhood Police Posts. However, as part of my personal projects, I've done quite a lot. For my language-learning adventures, I used a lot of web scraping to extract sample sentences given a certain queried word. As part of my geospatial adventures, I used web scraping to extract data pertaining to all sorts of features such as malls, schools and basically anything that doesn't yet have an official dataset.

game-development.title: Game Development
description: While I do know some basic C# and programming in Unity, most of my game development was done in Python, mainly creating my
. I have also been working on my
, which uses employs the use of JavaScript regex.

data-cleaning.title: Data Cleaning
description: The data cleaning process involves fixing the incorrect, incomplete, duplicate or otherwise erroneous data in a dataset. With the help of inbuilt Python libraries like datetime and regex, as well as some of my own packages, I built comprehensive pipelines for processing complex data into usable formats. This included a lot of free-written text, so quite a bit of regex matching was needed to get the job done.

cloud-computing.title: Cloud Computing
description: Early tasks in cloud computing were to manage and use the APIs on Google Suite to assist in analytics work during my time in
introduced me to AWS and Azure cloud features.
But I think the most impactful projects I've made using Cloud Computing were my Telegram Bots, which operated on Google's Cloud Platform (

minutes-taking.title: Minutes-Taking
description: As part of my work in

, I sat in various departmental meetings where I had to record down minutes and summarise their key points. This improved my note-taking skills, as well as my ability to summarise large chunks of text.

robotics.title: Robotics
description: As an EXCO member of my
, I was heavily involved in Robotics, specifically VEX Robotics. After spending over a year in the club, I've picked up quite a few things along the way.
